alert.note: Alert for Iron; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 8:18PM MDT until August 22 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN IRON AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 818 PM MDT, Radar estimated rainfall of 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain fell in less than 30 minutes across the Kolob Canyon area of Zion National Park from earlier thunderstorms. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly...especially within the Taylor Creek and La Verkin Creek watersheds. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, slot canyons, and normally dry washes. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park, Kanarraville and Kolob Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
